reports.title: The Twitter Dashboard
reports.query:
The *Twitter Database* is a great way to get to know Neo4j and Cypher. This graph contains the following data:
- `Tweet` nodes with four properties (`id`, `created_at`, `text`, `favorites`).
- `User` nodes with six properties (`name`, `followers`, `following`, `location`, `profile_image_url`, `screen_name`).
- `HashTag` nodes with the property `name`.
- `Link` nodes with the property `url`.
- `Source` nodes with the property `name`.
- Two relationship types between `Tweet` and `User` (`POSTS`,  `MENTIONS`).
- Five relationship type between different `User` nodes (`FOLLOWS`, `INTERACTS_WITH`, `RT_MENTIONS`, `AMPLIFIES`, `SIMILAR_TO`).
- Five relationship type between different `Tweet` nodes (`REPLY_TO`, `RETWEETS`).
- One relationship types between `Tweet` and `Hashtag`, `TAGS`.
- One relationship types between `Tweet` and `Link`, `CONTAINS`.
- One relationship types between `Tweet` and `Source`, `USING`.

This dashboard uses the sample dataset from the Neo4j developer guide.
[https://neo4j.com/developer/example-data/](https://neo4j.com/developer/example-data/)

____


You will find two pages in this same dashboard:
1. An **Overview** page with general info about the graph.
2. An **User view** page that lets you drill down on a specific person.
3. A **Tweet view** page that lets you drill down on a specific tweet.

To inspect the Cypher behind each of the visualizations, click the (â‹®) button on the top right of a report. This lets you see and edit the query.

reports.title: The entire graph
Total Tweets
reports.query:
MATCH (n:Tweet)
RETURN COUNT(n) as Total

reports.title: Total Users
reports.query:
MATCH (n:User)
RETURN COUNT(n)

reports.title: Relationships
reports.query:
MATCH ()-[r]->()
RETURN count(r)

reports.title: Relationship types
reports.query:
MATCH ()-[r]->()
RETURN type(r) as Relationship, COUNT(r) as Total

reports.title: Browse the movies
reports.query:
MATCH (m:Tweet)
RETURN m.id_str as idx, m.text as Text

reports.title: Users with most tweets
reports.query:
MATCH (t:Tweet)<-[:POSTS]-(u:User)
RETURN u.name as User, COUNT(t) as Tweets
ORDER BY Tweets
DESC LIMIT 10

reports.title: Tweets by Month
reports.query:
MATCH (t:Tweet)
WHERE t.created_at is not null
WITH datetime(t.created_at).month as nMonth, apoc.temporal.format(t.created_at, "MMMM") as month
with nMonth, month, count(nMonth) as Total
RETURN nMonth, Total
ORDER by nMonth asc

reports.title: Total Sources
reports.query:
MATCH (n:Source)
RETURN COUNT(n) as Sources

reports.title: Total Hashtags
reports.query:
MATCH (n:Hashtag)
RETURN COUNT(n) as Hashtags

reports.title: Total Links
reports.query:
MATCH (n:Link)
RETURN COUNT(n) as Links

reports.title: Tweets distribution by Hasgtag
reports.query:
MATCH (t:Tweet)-[:TAGS]->(h:Hashtag)
RETURN h.name as Hashtag, COUNT(t) as Tweets
ORDER BY Tweets
DESC LIMIT 10

reports.title: Select an user
reports.query:
MATCH (t:Tweet)<-[:POSTS]-(u:User)
RETURN u.name as User, COUNT(t) as Tweets
ORDER BY Tweets desc

reports.title: Graph view for this user follow relationships
reports.query:
MATCH path=(p:User)-[:FOLLOWS]-()
WHERE p.name = $neodash_person_name
RETURN path

reports.title: About this page
reports.query: On this page, you can select a person from a table, and dynamically view other visualizations update.

reports.title: Tweets for the selected user
reports.query:
MATCH path=(p)-->(m:Tweet)
WHERE p.name = $neodash_person_name
and m.text is not null
RETURN m.created_at as Creation_Date, m.favorites as Favs, m.text as Text order by Favs desc

reports.title: The highest tweeted hashtags by this user
reports.query:
MATCH path=(p)-->(m:Tweet)-[:TAGS]->(t)
WHERE p.name = $neodash_person_name
RETURN t.name as HashTag, count(*) as Total

reports.title: Selected User
reports.query: RETURN $neodash_person_name

reports.title: About this page
reports.query: On this page, you can select a tweet from a table, and dynamically view other visualizations update.

reports.title: Selected User
reports.query: RETURN $neodash_person_name

reports.title: Graph of Tweets for this User. (Click on a Tweet for more info)
reports.query:
MATCH path=(p)-->(m:Tweet)
WHERE p.name = $neodash_person_name
RETURN path

reports.title: Tweet Info
reports.query:
MATCH path = (a:Tweet)-[b]-(c)
WHERE a.id = $neodash_tweet_info
RETURN path
